intro: Cordaea fabiformis, commonly known as the false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Cordaea fabiformis is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
